Package org.sontana

Class Behaviour

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sontana.Behaviour
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameSystem, Pawn
    public class Behaviour
extends java.lang.Object
    The Behaviour class is what objects in an AbstractScene derive from.

    Don't create a child of this class. Instead, use Pawn, Actor, or GameSystem.

    Author:
    Christophe Simon

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void disable()
      Disable a Behaviour to prevent its logic from executing.
      void enable()
      Enable a Behaviour so that its logic executes.
      void initialise()
      Code that runs when the object is created or when the scene begins.
      static void instantiate​(Behaviour... pBehaviours)
      Instantiate a Behaviour by adding it to the current active AbstractScene.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Check if a Behaviour is enabled or not.
      void lateUpdate()
      Code that runs at the end of every frame while the object is enabled.
      protected void onDisable()
      Code that runs after disabling an object.
      protected void onEnable()
      Code that runs after enabling an object.
      void update()
      Code that runs every frame while the object is enabled.
